content.description:
“Everybody’s Friend,” cartoon in Punch, British satirical newspaper, 1878Private Collection Look and Learn / George Collection/ Bridgeman Images
German Chancellor Bismarck sits at a table covered with the map of Europe. On the wall behind him are a map of Russia (left) and the three emperors of the Three Emperors’ League (right), with the German emperor covering the faces of the Austrian and Russian emperors.
content.question: Which of the following is the most likely explanation for the cartoonist’s choosing to portray Bismarck in a military uniform?

choices.label: The cartoonist was critiquing Bismarck’s employment of realpolitik to create his alliance system.
The cartoonist was commenting on the fact that while Bismarck presented himself as a diplomat, he used military force to achieve his aims.
The cartoonist was mocking the pretensions of German military power, seeing it as greatly inferior to Britain’s.
The cartoonist was showing his opposition to the general European military buildup of the late nineteenth century.

content.answer: The cartoonist was commenting on the fact that while Bismarck presented himself as a diplomat, he used military force to achieve his aims.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain the significance of a source's point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience, including how these might limit the use(s) of a source.
